title: Новая ратуша
text: Новая ратуша является резиденцией мэра и городского совета,  была построена в неоготическом стиле в 1909 году. В ратуше 400 комнат, в подвале работает ресторан.Богато украшен главный фасад ратуши. На нем изображен Генрих Лев, вся династия Виттельсбахов, конная статуя принца-регента Луитпольда.  На углу здания дракон Вурмек  напоминает об угрозе чумы. Ратушная башня высотой 85 метров увенчана фигурой Мюнхен Киндл -  герб Мюнхена с 13 века. Первоначально был изображен монах, держащий книгу, но затем его заменил ребенок с кружкой или редькой. На башне пятые по величине куранты в Европе. Карильон исполняет четыре различные мелодии подряд, 32 фигуры исполняют танец бочаров и рыцарский турнир на свадьбе герцога Вильгельма V. Это можно увидеть в  11-00 и 12-00 и в 17-00 с марта и по октябрь. А в 21-00 выходит ночной сторож, Мюнхен Киндл и ангел  желает городу и всем зевакам спокойной ночи.

title: Beautiful Neo-Gothic Town Hall with ornamental chiming clock attraction
text: There are numerous attractions to see at Marienplatz in the Old Town of Munich. However, none are as impressive as the Neo-Gothic Neus Rathaus (New Town Hall) which occupies the entire northern side of the square. This is a beautiful building constructed in the second half of the 19th-century, replacing the older and smaller Altes Rathaus (Old Town Hall) on the southeast side of Marienplatz. What you see here is a richly decorated facade with impressive Gothic features and numerous statues of figures representing the Wittlesbach dynasty. The clock tower is 85 metres tall and includes the delightful Glockenspiel, an ornamental chiming clock which performs twice a day (11am & 12pm) during winter months and a third time (5pm) during warmer months of the year. Do spend a few minutes to enjoy the exterior of the Neus Rathaus if you are fan of architecture and plan on being in the Marienplatz area of the Old Town during trips to Munich. Then continue onward, enjoying the monuments, fountains and other interesting buildings on the square.

title: 荘厳,自由の砦
text: 2019/04/23ミュンヘン初訪問、たまたま12時前にMARIENPLATZに到着しました。沢山の観光客（でしょうか？）が今か今かとカメラ片手にGLOCKENSPIEL（新市庁舎の仕掛け時計）が動くのを待っていました。仕掛け時計は二つあり上は貴族の結婚式、下はビールの樽をつくる職人たちが登場。と現地の方に伺いました。正１２時やっと動き出したが遠くて高くよく見れませんでした。それはともかく重厚なミュンヘンのランドマークは戦災に合わなかったのでしょうか？MARIENPLATZ周辺には有名なホーフブロイハウス、デリカテッセンのダルマイヤー（喫茶店は超満員でした。）FCバイエルンのグッズショップ、百貨店のGAREIAKAUHOFその他沢山揃っています。すぐ近くには野外市場VIKTUALIENMARKTがあり祭日でもないのに皆さん大挙してそこそこで買い物どころか、グループでビールを本当に美味しそうに飲んでいました。

title: Semplicemente spettacolare
text: E' il simbolo di Monaco. Spettacolare nelle sue forme gotiche, occupa un intero isolato e con la sua mole si affaccia su uno dei lati lunghi di Marienplatz. Bisogna fermarsi un bel pò per ammirare tutti i dettagli architettonici che compongono la facciata principale. Spicca la torre dell'orologio dove si trova il Glockenspiel, un carillon con statuette che eseguono un tradizionale balletto tre volte al giorno (ore 11, 12 e 15). Da non perdere la visita degli interni del palazzo, che, ricordo, è la sede del municipio della città. Non c'è nessun vincolo e non si paga, basta entrare e fare attenzione a non perdersi tra i bellissimi ambienti interni ricchi di colonne, scaloni e volte gotiche, e, naturalmente, non disturbare l'attività di chi vi lavora. Per avere l'idea della maestosità dell'edificio bisogna salire sulla torre della dirimpettaia Peterkirche (costa 3 euro) da dove si gode il panorama a 360° di tutta la città. Al piano terra del municipio si trova l'Ufficio Informazioni Turistico dove tutto il personale parla italiano.

title: Monumental piece of Gothic architecture
text: This wonderful building dominates the focal point of Munich’s main tourist location, the Marienplatz. It’s an absolute feast of Gothic architecture, all towers and niches with innumerable statues. The main feature is the Glockenspiel on the central tower, with its 43 bells and 42 moving figures. This tells the story of the marriage of a local nobleman and a French noblewoman. The performance lasts about five minutes and happens three times every day: at 11am, noon and 5pm. For many visitors it’s quite rightly the highlight of being in Munich.

title: Magnificent building that time to time shows a musical performance.
text: Incredibly magnificent building. This town hall, in my opinion, is the most beautiful building of this type that could be found in Germany (at least from my point of view of the five cities that I visited). I saw different town halls, both new and old, and in good condition, and in a more "tired", historical... but I have never seen such a monumental, large town hall at the same time elegant and rigid in architecture. The Town Hall is a neo-Gothic building in which there are 400 rooms with a total area of ​​more than 9 thousand sq. m., and was built in 1867-1908. On the central tower of the town hall, there are chimes that play a 15-minute performance. Every day at 11 o'clock 43 bells begin to beat, windows open, and 32 figures begin to play scenes from city life. In summer, the performance is at 12 and 17 hours too.In the courtyard and on one side of the town hall there are entrances to a very beautiful restaurant, which is located under the town hall and which serves delicious food.

text: Fast alle Besucher in München möchten um 12 Uhr das Glockenspiel hier erleben. Sehr viele Asiatische Menschen mit Kamera unterwegs. Ist aber auch Seeeehr schön und interessant mal mit zu erleben.

title: Missed the glockenspiel
text: Sad that I missed the glockenspiel due to time constraints beyond my control, but a fabulous piece of architecture.

title: Pour le carillon
text: Principal bâtiment de la MarienPlatz, vous ne pourrez pas le louper lors de votre visite de la ville. Passer les porches pour découvrir la cour intérieure et patienter pour voir les automates du carillon s’animées à 17h.

title: Impressive building
text: Impressive neo-gothic architectural building on the very busy Marienplatz.Recommend checking out the tower climb to get great views of Munich, and the clock tower show.

title: Majestuoso edificio.
text: El Nuevo Ayuntamiento es un majestuoso edificio que preside la Mareinplatz, el centro de la capital bávara. La parte más destacada es su torre que se eleva en mitad de su espléndida fachada, y a la que se puede acceder en ascensor. Una vez en lo alto tienes una magnífica visión de todo el centro de Munich, y en días despejados de toda la ciudad.
